did.unittitle: Alpha Phi, Beta Nu Chapter Records

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Alpha Phi. Beta Nu Chapter (Duke University)

did.abstract: The Alpha Phi, Beta Nu Chapter was founded at Duke University in 1935. The Alpha Phi, Beta Nu Chapter Records include minutes from 1935-1946 and a photograph.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Alpha Phi sorority was founded at Syracuse University in 1872. The Beta Nu Chapter was founded at Duke University in 1935.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Copyright for Official University records is held by Duke University; all other copyright is retained by the authors of items in these papers, or their descendants, as stipulated by United States copyright law.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Alpha Phi, Beta Nu Chapter Records were received by the Duke University Archives as a gift in 2016.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Alpha Phi, Beta Nu Chapter Records, Duke University Archives, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Chi Omega Fraternity. Mu Kappa Chapter (Duke University) records, University Archives, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.
Fraternities and Sororities Collection, Duke University Archives, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The collection includes minutes from Alpha Phi meetings and an undated photograph of Alpha Phi members with their dates at an event. Minutes are in a single bound volume and begin with the first meeting of the sorority in September 1935 through April 1946; minutes discuss event planning, administrative business, and other topics.
